CARDIGAN: A type of sweater or jumper that fastens up the front with buttons or a zipper, usually machine- or hand-knitted from wool.
FLANNEL: A soft cloth material woven from wool, possibly combined with cotton or synthetic fibers.
FLEECE: Hair or wool of a sheep or similar animal
SCARF: A long, often knitted, garment worn around the neck.
SWEATER: A knitted jacket or jersey, usually of thick wool, worn by athletes before or after exercise.
VEST: A loose robe or outer garment worn historically by men in Arab or Middle Eastern countries.
